intro: Rhabdotosperma saudiarabicum, commonly known as the Arabian sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, white to yellowish flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry climates. The fruit is a dry, two-lobed structure that disperses seeds by wind, aiding in its survival in harsh desert conditions.
